main event: A bright light was observed flashing on and off in Jackson, Mississippi on May 17, 1957.
interesting points: The light was observed for approximately 20 to 30 minutes and was visible through breaks in the clouds., The object was estimated to be at an altitude of approximately 700 to 1,000 feet and 1/4 to 1/2 mile in diameter., Witnesses reported the object hovering and stationary with respect to the ground., Various documents indicated that there were attempts to explain the sighting as a normal aircraft situation., There were no confirmed photographs taken of the object during the sighting.
sighted object: a bright flashing light in the sky
witness description: a professional hydraulic engineer, Grade GS-16, employed by the Corps of Engineers, U.S. Army
